meanings.sent1: The hypochromic painting lacked vibrant hues.
meanings.sent2: The black and white movie had a hypochromic appearance.
meanings.sent3: The hypochromic rainbow looked like a faded watercolor.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe seemed hypochromic compared to the bright summer trends.
meanings.sent5: The hypochromic sky at dusk was a subtle blend of gray and blue.

meanings.definition: A red blood cell that is paler than normal
meanings.sent1: The doctor observed hypochromic cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Anemia can be diagnosed by the presence of hypochromic red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The hypochromic blood cells were like tiny pale discs.
meanings.sent4: The hypochromic cells floated in the plasma like ghostly orbs.
meanings.sent5: The hypochromic cells struggled to carry enough oxygen throughout the body.
